summary: Happy Birthday! Wanted to ask, what is it about book Sansa and/or Jon that draws your interest in them? Other characters besides...
question: Happy Birthday! Wanted to ask, what is it about book Sansa and/or Jon that draws your interest in them? Other characters besides the 2 that you like from the books?
answer:
Right from the word go I identified really strongly with Jon: his sense of never belonging, his low key bitterness, his yearning for something (Winterfell, belonging, not being a bastard) he can never have. Funnily enough though I tend to find his chapters in the first two books once he gets to Castle Black really boring; it’s not till he meets Ygritte that I find his plot to be interesting again. I’ll get a bit into this as we get into his Castle Black chapters in my reread, but I think there’s two main reasons for it.

The first is that his entire plot in the first book is a series of deciding not to do something (go back south) and while Martin gets a lot of important world building elements set in place, in terms of pacing it just isn’t that interesting. Second, I have this thing were I don’t like overly large male casts, and Jon’s plotline is a complete sausage fest until he meets Ygritte.

Sansa it took me longer to warm to. I can’t quite remember what I thought of her the first time I read the books (that’s about fifteen years gone by this point), though we’ll see if my rereads help me remember. What I did eventually grow to appreciate about Sansa is her inner strength and outer courtesy, the kindness she has for others and the way she weathers everything that comes at her. And as a character she’s such a complex character to write, with so much trauma and trust issues, a dichotomy of hard and soft.

I actually love a bunch of book characters (basically all of the viewpoint characters). But to pick out a few in specific:

  • Arianne: anything with Dorne I love, but Arianne in particular is such a great character.
  • Dany: maybe surprisingly considering how polarizing fandom has gotten, I actually like Dany and her storyline quite a bit.
  • Brienne: show Brienne and book Brienne are radically different characters and I really prefere the latter to the former.
  • Catelyn: outside of how she treats Jon I quite like Catelyn and find her narrative really interesting.
  • Ygritte: I know she had to die, but I’m still sad about it.
  • Val: I like anyone that makes Jon’s storyline less of a sausage fest and her and Jon’s back and forth in ADWD is great.

Thanks for the question!

summary: A Broken Lady For Two Bastards - YourDarkestWishes - Game of Thrones (TV) [Archive of Our Own]
title: A Broken Lady For Two Bastards - YourDarkestWishes - Game of Thrones (TV) [Archive of Our Own]
excerpt: An Archive of Our Own, a project of the Organization for Transformative Works
description:
Chapters: 1/1
Fandom: Game of Thrones (TV), A Song of Ice and Fire - George R. R. Martin
Rating: Explicit
Warnings: Graphic Depictions Of Violence, Rape/Non-Con
Relationships: Jon Snow/Sansa Stark, Ramsay Bolton/Sansa Stark, Ramsay Bolton/Sansa Stark/Jon Snow
Characters: Jon Snow, Sansa Stark, Ramsay Bolton
Additional Tags: Explicit Sexual Content, Explicit Language, Rough Sex, Anal Sex, Masturbation, Knifeplay, Orgasm Delay/Denial, Forced Orgasm, Object Penetration, Threesome - F/M/M, Rape/Non-con Elements, Anger, Hate Sex, Resentment, Mind Manipulation, Mind Games, Sadism, Cunnilingus, Half-Sibling Incest, Cousin Incest (they don’t know they are cousins), Table Sex, Voyeurism, Hair-pulling, Descent into Madness, Woman on Top, Cowgirl Position, Ramsay is His Own Warning, Game of Thrones Canon AU, Post-Episode: s06e09 Battle of the Bastards, Alternate AU - Ramsay Wins The BOTB, Dark! Jon Snow, And I Mean Actually Dark! Jon Snow, Not Semi-Sweet Dark! Jon, Actual Dark!
Summary:

Game Of Thrones AU: Ramsay Bolton intercepts the plan for the Knights Of the Vale and wins the Battle Of The Bastards. He takes as political prisoners his wife-turned-traitor, Sansa Stark Bolton, and his opponent, Jon Snow. He shows exactly what all his “mercy” entails and uncovers dark desires between Lady and Bastard.
Prompt request by Anon and Jonarya786.
Warnings are tagged. Readers continue knowing the subject matter. Contains Non-Con and Mental Instability. And smut.

blog.name: tacitwhisky
blog.title: Tacit Whisky
blog.description: I write fanfic. Sometimes it's good. Check me out on AO3.

summary: What other ships do you ship?
title: What other ships do you ship?
body:
Following from this ask: this is actually a bit tricky to answer. I don’t ship anyone as hard as I do Jon and Sansa (really, I haven’t shipped anyone as hard I do the two of them in years no matter the fandom). There’s a bunch of smaller ships I passively like but am not too invested in: Jaime/Brienne, Arya/Gendry, Robb/Jeyne/anyone who makes him happy and not dead.

For Jon and Sansa I’ve noticed that I’m a little odd among Jonsa shippers because I’m far more comfortable shipping Jon with other people than I am with Sansa. In the abstract I get the appeal of other people with Sansa (theonsa, for example) but in practice I don’t like reading them. It’s a weird thing, especially because I tend to treat Jon like the fandom bicycle.

I really liked him with Ygritte, and in the books he and Val have a chemistry that I think is fun to explore. Him and Alys Karstark as well. I’ve also read fic with Roslin Frey and Jeyne Westerling that were really good, and Jon/Arianne is a crackship that I’m strangely passionate about.

Ultimately though I don’t ship anything as much or as intensely as I do Jon and Sansa.

(If there’s some interest I can put together a rec list for Jon/other ladies, but most of my followers are solid Jonsa shippers I think)

summary: Broken In - oponn - Game of Thrones (TV) [Archive of Our Own]
body:
Broken In - oponn - Game of Thrones (TV) [Archive of Our Own]

Read this wonderful SanSan one-shot! It’s a show-canon fix-it creating a missing scene after the feast at Winterfell.

It’s smutty, sure, but what really gets you are the absolutely correct feels and the lovely writing.

summary: I heard this song today. I am not a hopeless romantic, but the lyrics got stuck in my head ...  And it’s not even my genre...
caption:
I heard this song today. I am not a hopeless romantic, but the lyrics got stuck in my head …  And it’s not even my genre (right now i’m listening to Faith no More)

I Knew I Loved You by Savage Garden

Maybe it’s intuition
But some things you just don’t question
Like in your eyes, I see my future in an instant
And there it goes,
I think I found my best friend
I know that it might sound
More than a little crazy
But I believe

I knew I loved you before I met you
I think I dreamed you into life
I knew I loved you before I met you
I have been waiting all my life

There’s just no rhyme or reason
Only the sense of completion
And in your eyes, I see
The missing pieces I’m searching for
I think I’ve found my way home
I know that it might sound
More than a little crazy
But I believe

I knew I loved you before I met you
I think I dreamed you into life
I knew I loved you before I met you
I have been waiting all my life

A thousand…

summary: Did a quick study of Sophie Turner yesterday as a warm up. I don’t feel like it’s as accurate as the Sansa Stark sketch I did a...
body:
Did a quick study of Sophie Turner yesterday as a warm up. I don’t feel like it’s as accurate as the Sansa Stark sketch I did a few months ago so I may start from scratch and try again.

Just an update: I am finishing up the messaging and everything for requests and will be starting on them soon! Rn I’m having some trouble with my health so it may take me a bit longer than I’d like to get started, but the second I’m feeling better I will be getting them to ya’ll ASAP.

blog.name: silkygoldmilkweed
blog.title: sansa stark & sandor clegane are soulmates

tags: a song of ice and fire
summary: Am I crazy or does this scene go out of its way to validate virtually everything the SanSan fandom has been saying about this...
body:
Am I crazy or does this scene go out of its way to validate virtually everything the SanSan fandom has been saying about this ship for 20 years and destroy any arguments that “he was an abuser who traumatized her”?

To my eyes, this scene canonizes the notion that she’s the boss of him and always has been. The much-discussed power disparity between them is not keyed to Sandor’s size and propensity for violence versus her delicate gentility but to Sansa’s high station, general hauteur and diplomatically significant position versus his iconoclastic giving of zero fucks.

blog.name: acourtofhopeanddreams
blog.title: Enjoy the little things!
blog.description:
Open your heart
To the love of the world
It only needs one person
Touching it with 
A word
A look
A smile
A kiss

title: Northern Ravens - Chapter 4
body:
Sansa is Queen in the North while Jon is banished to serve the Night’s Watch for the rest of his life. And yet, Sansa can’t just accept that Jon can never come home again, that he will never be able to answer the feelings she has for him, that she will have to marry someone else to let him father the future heirs of the North. And so she sends ravens. Ravens to Jon to tell him how much she misses him. And ravens to Bran to ask him when it is safe to end Jon’s punishment and bring him back to Winterfell.

Chapter 1 // Chapter 2 // Chapter 3

Even though her lips were red and swollen from kissing and even though she was out of breath because she couldn’t bring herself to separate her mouth from his long enough to breath, Sansa still longed to be much closer to Jon that she currently was. He had his arms firmly wrapped around her and yet she hated the thick layers of clothing they were wearing to protect themselves against the piercing cold. For too long she had had to miss his touch and the heat of his body keeping her warm. Now she was finally here, staying here in the cold with all those eyes watching them and all those clothes on seemed like a waste of what little time they had together.

But she was a Queen now and all those people staring at them were her people. And no matter how much she wanted to lock herself up with him in his bedroom to not come out again until they had to leave again, she knew she couldn’t do so.

He was her lover, the man she wanted to marry, the future father of her children and the King she wanted to rule besides her. But he was also the man who had gathered the biggest army ever seen, who had made it possible to defeat the Night King and who had saved the North of what could have been a bloodbath by killing the Dragon Queen before she could unleash her dragon on the very place she had helped to protect.

“I wish we could take you home with us…” Sansa exhaled. Her warm breath was visible in the cold winter air. “But Bran told me it was too early, too soon.” She let her head rest on his broad shoulder. She doubted if he was still fighting or practicing with his sword and yet she couldn’t imagine anyone else she’d feel this safe and at home with. “I’m glad he gave me an excuse to come here and visit you, though…”

Jon’s hand went through her hair and he twirled a loose strand around the tip of his finger. “I’m not sure if I’m glad he made you do that.” He whispered and his lips were almost touching her ear. “Because now I’ve got to let you go again. And I don’t know if I can do that.”

Sansa closed her eyes. She knew that Jon was right. In a few weeks she would have to get on her horse again and that horse would carry her back to Winterfell. And neither of them knew when they would see each other again. But she didn’t want to ruin this moment of happiness, of finally being with him again and being able to talk to him again without having to wait days for an answer. “You shouldn’t talk about that yet. We have a few more weeks before I have to leave again, maybe by then you will be tired of me and get headaches because I’m talking too much.”

Jon smiled and his lips kissed her forehead. “I’ll never grow tired of you.” He pressed the palms of his hands to her glowing cheeks before he kissed her slightly parted lips again. “And you can talk as much as you like. I missed hearing your ramblings and I missed your voice of reason.”

Sansa’s lips curled up, but the magical moment was disturbed when one of her guards cleared his throat.

“My apologies, your majesties.” His voice trembled slightly. “It’s getting dark soon. We need to unsaddle the horses and get them comfortable for the night.”

Sansa looked at Jon, but Jon kept silent. She was the Queen now, she was the ruler of the North now and just like everyone else Jon now waited for her commands. “Jon…” She remembered that she had promised to ask him how her men should address him. “Could you send a few men to help the Northerners to settle?”

“Of course, my Queen.” Jon nodded and stepped back from her to talk to a few of his friends, who kept a polite distance ever since Sansa had rushed through the gate. He maybe was no longer a King and he maybe didn’t even want to be one anymore, but he still moved and behaved like one. Not like the one who would just order people around to do whatever he wanted them to do. He still was the kind of King people wanted to fight for and fight with. He still was the kind of King people believed in and trusted with their lives.

A few seconds later his men walked towards the gathered Northern caravan and lead them away to the stables so the horses could finally get some well deserved rest.

“You can banish a King from his Kingdom, but he’ll always be a King…” Sansa only realised that she had said the words out loud when Jon let his forehead rest on hers.

“I’m not a King anymore, Sansa.” Jon spoke softly. “And I don’t need to be one. The North has a Queen, a wonderful Queen.” He smiled. “She’s intelligent and just. She’s soft and strong. She’s beautiful and brave.” He paused for a moment and his eyes stared straight into hers. “And she most of all doesn’t need a King.”

“I do need a King.” Sansa closed her eyes. She was intelligent and just and soft and strong and beautiful and brave. But she was also just a girl who longed to be loved and cared for. “I do need you.”

“But not as your King.” Jon’s nose brushed hers. “Even when Bran says it’s okay for me to come home…” He swallowed. “I still don’t wanna be King again.” His lips touched hers carefully. “I want to be your husband. I want to be the father of your children. I want to help you raise the future Kings and Queens in the North.” He shook his head. “But I really don’t want to be King anymore.”

“I was already designing a beautiful crown for you.” Sansa placed her hands on his shoulders. “One to match my tiara.”

“You shouldn’t be making me a crown. You should make one for you. A real crown for a true Queen, for the rightful ruler of the most beautiful Kingdom of Westeros.”

The smile on Sansa’s face brightened and then she kissed him once more. “If only all Kings, Princes and Lords I encountered had been like you. The world would have been a much better place.”

Sansa looked at Jon, but Jon kept silent. She was the Queen now, she was the ruler of the North now and just like everyone else Jon now waited for her commands. “Jon…” She remembered that she had promised to ask him how her men should address him. “Could you send a few men to help the Northerners to settle?”

“Of course, my Queen.” Jon nodded and stepped back from her to talk to a few of his friends, who kept a polite distance ever since Sansa had rushed through the gate. He maybe was no longer a King and he maybe didn’t even want to be one anymore, but he still moved and behaved like one. Not like the one who would just order people around to do whatever he wanted them to do. He still was the kind of King people wanted to fight for and fight with. He still was the kind of King people believed in and trusted with their lives.

A few seconds later his men walked towards the gathered Northern caravan and lead them away to the stables so the horses could finally get some well deserved rest.

“You can banish a King from his Kingdom, but he’ll always be a King…” Sansa only realised that she had said the words out loud when Jon let his forehead rest on hers.

“I’m not a King anymore, Sansa.” Jon spoke softly. “And I don’t need to be one. The North has a Queen, a wonderful Queen.” He smiled. “She’s intelligent and just. She’s soft and strong. She’s beautiful and brave.” He paused for a moment and his eyes stared straight into hers. “And she most of all doesn’t need a King.”

“I do need a King.” Sansa closed her eyes. She was intelligent and just and soft and strong and beautiful and brave. But she was also just a girl who longed to be loved and cared for. “I do need you.”

“But not as your King.” Jon’s nose brushed hers. “Even when Bran says it’s okay for me to come home…” He swallowed. “I still don’t wanna be King again.” His lips touched hers carefully. “I want to be your husband. I want to be the father of your children. I want to help you raise the future Kings and Queens in the North.” He shook his head. “But I really don’t want to be King anymore.”

“I was already designing a beautiful crown for you.” Sansa placed her hands on his shoulders. “One to match my tiara.”

“You shouldn’t be making me a crown. You should make one for you. A real crown for a true Queen, for the rightful ruler of the most beautiful Kingdom of Westeros.”

The smile on Sansa’s face brightened and then she kissed him once more. “If only all Kings, Princes and Lords I encountered had been like you. The world would have been a much better place.”
trail.content_abstract:
Sansa is Queen in the North while Jon is banished to serve the Night’s Watch for the rest of his life. And yet, Sansa can’t just accept that Jon can never come home again, that he will never be able to answer the feelings she has for him, that she will have to marry someone else to let him father the future heirs of the North. And so she sends ravens. Ravens to Jon to tell him how much she misses him. And ravens to Bran to ask him when it is safe to end Jon’s punishment and bring him back to Winterfell.

Chapter 1 // Chapter 2 // Chapter 3

Even though her lips were red and swollen from kissing and even though she was out of breath because she couldn’t bring herself to separate her mouth from his long enough to breath, Sansa still longed to be much closer to Jon that she currently was. He had his arms firmly wrapped around her and yet she hated the thick layers of clothing they were wearing to protect themselves against the piercing cold. For too long she had had to miss his touch and the heat of his body keeping her warm. Now she was finally here, staying here in the cold with all those eyes watching them and all those clothes on seemed like a waste of what little time they had together.

But she was a Queen now and all those people staring at them were her people. And no matter how much she wanted to lock herself up with him in his bedroom to not come out again until they had to leave again, she knew she couldn’t do so.

He was her lover, the man she wanted to marry, the future father of her children and the King she wanted to rule besides her. But he was also the man who had gathered the biggest army ever seen, who had made it possible to defeat the Night King and who had saved the North of what could have been a bloodbath by killing the Dragon Queen before she could unleash her dragon on the very place she had helped to protect.

“I wish we could take you home with us…” Sansa exhaled. Her warm breath was visible in the cold winter air. “But Bran told me it was too early, too soon.” She let her head rest on his broad shoulder. She doubted if he was still fighting or practicing with his sword and yet she couldn’t imagine anyone else she’d feel this safe and at home with. “I’m glad he gave me an excuse to come here and visit you, though…”

summary: Of all the things the queen of Winterfell thought she would have to deal with that day, chasing a pig, who was chasing Arya, was...
question: Of all the things the queen of Winterfell thought she would have to deal with that day, chasing a pig, who was chasing Arya, was certainly not high on her list.
answer:
Of all the things the queen of Winterfell thought she would have to deal with that day, chasing a pig, who was chasing Arya, was certainly not high on her list.


“My bet is on Lady Arya!”


Sansa spared a glance back to glare at Tormund Giantsbane, who had the cheek to roar with laughter. Next to him, Jon raised his tankard as if to say, What can you do with a Wildling?


“You cannot teach them table manners, that’s for sure,” Sansa huffed just as Arya shimmied up the nearest post, standing with her hands on her hips.


She cupped her hands to her mouth and shouted, “Reeee!”


The pig turned in its tracks and charged at Sansa, who covered her eyes. There was a loud, wet sound, and the pig’s head went rolling down the stones, coming to a rest at her feet.


Sansa opened her eyes to stare dumbly at Ser Podrick Payne, who wiped off his sword and bowed, a blush staining his fair cheek. She intimated Arya with a slight incline of her head, still standing on the post amidst racuous cheers.


Podrick stepped back, seemingly blindsided by Sansa’s favor. His broad back hit the post, Arya lost her balance, and toppled into the midden.


Ignoring the vengeful look her sister bestowed upon her, Sansa proclaimed, “It seems we shall be roasting a pig for the feast tonight.”


If anyone wondered why the youngest Lady Stark was eating an apple in the morning as she shot sly looks at her sister, it was anyone’s guess.
